page.title: 19GAMES PLAYED IN HONING
page.content: HANDSTANDS: A caller nominates variations of handstand forms as follows- jellywobble (legs shaken in the air), banana splits (legs parted) chinese lantern (legs form diamond shape), lock (feet close to back). After each call, the participant judged to be most successful by the caller becomes caller in turn. RABBIT STUCK IN THE MUD: One catcher catches participants by touching them. When touched the captive stands still with arms and legs outstretched until being touched and thus freed by a free participant, who can also release by crawling between the captives legs. BUTTERFINGERS: Ball bowled to batsman who deliberately hits the ball high into the air. If fielder nearest to the descending ball fails to catch it, he/she loudly called butterfingers. A successful catcher becomes batsman.
